my mistake when transfer between eth and usd coin use uniswapso the other day i decide to make a transfer of eth to usd coin for my own personal reason without even think first place that pop into my mind uniswap as i though the cost of send eth from my wallet to an exchange change to usdcoin and then send back would be more expensive low and behold i look on etherscan and find out the transaction cost i over 100 upon further inspection i also learn that there be no direct route between eth and usd coin on uniswap and that transaction have to go eth wbtc usd coin fast forward i need to do the same thing in a similar transaction but instead of reach straight to uniswap i decide to try use an exchange so i send the correct amount of eth from my wallet to the exchange purchased usdc with say eth and send it back to my wallet all in all pay over 100 in fee on uniswap and around 19 on say exchange what be the moral of the story and my view on this do not always doubt that exchange will be more expensive than dex especially when say dexs do not have a direct pair it be very frustrating it happen to i but i would hope its a lesson to anyone else here who be not aware of this

pandacoin pnd what be pandacoin pandacoin be a decentralised peer to peer digital cryptocurrency it be an environmentally friendly coin that aim to become universally adopt through its fairness honesty and sustainability pandacoin s lead developer be timon sae amdoge how do pandacoin work the pandacoin network use a combination of the proof of stake and proof of work sha256d consensus mechanism to validate new transaction and add they to the pandacoin blockchain proof of work in proof of work miner use their computer hardware to solve a hash in order to verify a transaction s authenticity the first miner to solve the hash be give the block reward as a result of the competitive nature miner buy well and well hardware in order to get more block reward this have cause concern about proof of work s energy consumption in particular bitcoin bitcoin be the most popular cryptocurrency and there be huge mining farm dedicate solely to mine it these mining farm use a lot of electricity while mine for bitcoin proof of stake alternatively in proof of stake a node be choose at random to create the next block in the blockchain in order to ensure that this node do not create a fraudulent block they must put a portion of their coin at stake hence why it be call proof of stake once the node create the block it will broadcast it to the rest of the network for approval if the network agree that the block be valid it will be add to the blockchain and the creator will get their stake back plus a reward for their work on the other hand if the network agree it be an invalid block the network will usually just disconnect from the offending node however in more serious case the node may lose a portion of or even its entire stake the benefit of use both pandacoin use both of these consensus mechanism to ensure utmost network security and to be a sustainable coin for all pandacoin have a mild bias for create pos block there be a force 41 ratio of pos to pow block and the target be 61 to ensure that huge mining farm be not build over mining pnd the reward for find a pow block have a theoretical limit of 999 pnd however in practice the real limit be much low at around 250 pnd the current high pow block reward can be see on the pandacoin blockchain explorer here httpschainzcryptoidinfopndtxdws2htmhttpschainzcryptoidinfopndtxdws2htm another interesting thing to note be the reward for find a block be inversely link to the difficulty of find say block for more information about the technical specification of pandacoin please visit our wiki httpswikipandacointechwhatispandacointechnicalspecificationhttpswikipandacointechwhatispandacointechnicalspecification the history of pandacoin launch pandacoin launch in early 2014 with no initial coin offering icos no pre mine or insta mine to ensure a fair distribution of the pandacoin supply as previously discuss pandacoin launch without an ico pre mine or insta mine to ensure a fair wealth distribution let us take a look at what each of these term mean and why they be detrimental to a fair supply distribution termdefinition initial coin offering icosthe developers allow people to buy a certain amount of the coin s supply before its launch in exchange for a more stable cryptocurrency such as btc or eth or a fiat currency pre minesthe developers mine a portion usually a large one of the supply for themselves before the project gets officially launch to the wide community insta minesthe developers or dev team set the reward for the first few block of the blockchain to have very high block reward so that they can easily mine them naturally these process heavily skew the supply distribution of a coin towards the developer and early investor pandacoin launch with none of these why pandacoin exist in february of 2014 an individual name wolong create a coin call pandacoin panda panda be a pump and dump scheme that many people unfortunately fall for after see wolong reap the benefit of his scam a portion of the early dogecoin community decide that enough be enough a group of developer lead by timon sae amdoge quickly make a coin of their own also call pandacoin pnd the scam coin proof of stake implementation after a 2014 community vote pandacoin choose to implement the proof of stake consensus mechanism to validate new transaction this vote make pandacoin one of the make send and receive pnd simple pandacoin transaction fee be very small too usually 23 pnd per transaction far as a result of the network swap the wallet sync so fast that you might not even notice parachain auctions first let s get certain nomenclature establish the example follow will be from kusamas parachain auction as you know blockchain technology be a decentralized distributed ledger that record the provenance of a digital asset this data be unable to be modify parachain be individual layer1 blockchain that run in parallel on polkadot connect to the polkadot relay chain and secure by its validator set any type of datum or asset can be send between parachain parachain connect to the relay chain by lease a parachain slot via auction by be grant a slot by polkadot governance as a external network such as bitcoin and ethereum use cross network bridge candle auction be a variant of open auction where bidder submit bid that be increasingly high and the high bidder at the conclusion of the auction be consider the winner when candle auction be use online they require a random number to decide the moment of termination parachain slot auction differ slightly from a normal candle auction in that it do not use the random number to decide the duration of its opening phase instead it have a know open phase and will be retroactively determine at the normal close to have end at some point in the past during the end phase so during the open phase bid will continue to be accept but later bid have high probability of lose since the retroactively determine close moment may be block babe assign block production slot to validator accord to stake and use the polkadot randomness cycle validator in polkadot will participate in a lottery in every slot that will tell they whether or not they be the block producer candidate for that slot because of this randomness mechanism multiple validator could be candidate for the same slot other time a slot could be empty result in inconsistent block time to become a parachain on polkadot a project have to win a slot auction with the max duration they can lease on it be 2 year a full slot be divide into 8 lease period make the my research on future ethereum energy usehello r ethereum community i be study environmental management and i have recently finish a research project on ethereum s future energy consumption under proof of stake i have originally post this in r ethfinance but be ask to share it with those of you interested as well you can find the full report herehttpswwwdropboxcom s f1nle6ioiyz5wbfe28098proof of stakee2809920as20a20solution20to20the20blockchain20energy20problempdfdl0 for all other i ll quickly summarise the result ethereum mining be currently estimate to use around 80 twh of energy annuallyhttpsdigiconomistnet ethereum energy consumption i try to model energy consumption for proof of stake currently there be about 250000 active validator i split validator into two category private staker and institutional staker private staker be people run a setup from home or host on a cloud server each staker currently run 54 validator on average because they probably do not have setup optimize for energy consumption i estimate every staker to use 100w of energy so about 1852w per validator for institutional staker such as exchange i use 5 w per validator as suggest by carl beekhuizen from the ethereum foundationhttpsblogethereumorg20210518 country power no more currently about half of validator seem to be run by each category this put the current estimate energy consumption at 294 mw or 25754 gwh annually for the future i have consider a limit of 524000 validator as propose by vitalik in the past i make one model assume the share of private vs institutional staker remain 50 50 and one that assume a shift towards circa 25 75 since there will probably be more people use stake service rather than set up new own validator in the future the last scenario which i find to be more likely put power consumption at 431 mw or 37756 gwh annually the 50 50 scenario would mean 616mw 5398 gwh annually overall the transition to proof of stake represent a decrease in energy consumption by at least 9993 to 9995 percent compare to current pow so instead of use as much power as the entire country of chile ethereum will only use the equivalent of between 710 to 1650 average australians in the future of course those number could change slightly in case the maximum number of validator end up significantly high or the stake need for a validator be to change but this model at least be able to demonstrate the magnitude in difference for power consumption between pow and pos ps please do not be too harsh on my report the main focus be on the environmental impact of ethereum and the technical detail be very simplified if you want to share my report somewhere please dm i

power in any network there be a limited number of entity that produce block it do not matter if they be call pool or validator what matter be that these entity must satisfy some protocol condition and delegation of decision make power or if you prefer the delegation of control be a very important process in term of decentralization we can divide this activity into two category a trust delegation be one in which the choice of the delegator can not be influence or change by a third party this mean that the delegator itself directly decide which pool it delegate coin or energy to if there be any problem with a pool the delegator can immediately change his choice this weaken the rogue pool and strengthen another pool that be behave fairly an untrusted delegation be a delegation in which the owner of the resource use the service of third party this mean that the resource owner do not have direct control over their choice they may express their wish but the third party be one that carry out the will of the delegator and may or may not comply if there be a sudden problem the delegator do not have full control over the delegation and can not react quickly by delegate to another pool if necessary third party may misuse the provide resource for an attack the resource may be steal or the resource may somehow be prevent from be use clearly the ecosystem should support the existence of trust delegation as much as possible untrustworthy delegation be a threat to decentralization let s show example stake through a centralized exchange be a typical example of untrusted delegation ethereum have be criticize for it be astronomical fee it be unwillingness to alleviate those fee if it mean sacrifice decentralization even a little and it be slow time to make progress and code upgrade delay cardano be an academic research project that rely on a variant of dpos call oroboros for security it improve on the dpos protocol by allow any number of validator which eliminate some of the drawback of dpos vs pos delegation separate the voting power of a validator from the amount they personally hold and give they voting power equal to the coin of those who delegate to they it require a level of trust of those stake to those validate this be not inherently bad and dpos can still be very secure but remove the need for trust be one of the pillar of blockchain cardano aim to be the blockchain for mission critical application it be code language haskell be peer review and use academically for secure application haskell have be criticize as a language for be a pain to code node and participate in secure the network the compute cost be quite high server grade hardware be all but required and internet speed that be not even available for most consumer 300 m upload minimum 1 g upload recommend solana have a poh proof of history consensus mechanism which be really a different modify pos system solana find a way to agree on the order of transaction amongst it be node rather than rely on who pay the high fee like what most validator use to determine the next block what i find the most interesting about solana be that if a validator gets slash for act maliciously all those delegate to they also get slash this may seem like a scary thing for user but it be actually really good for the network to have downside risk it force user to carefully evaluate validator before delegate however the outrageous cost of run a validator prohibit most user from spin up their own validator instead solana have be criticize for be too centralized which really be the point of cryptocurrency why bother use one if you can just use a centralized aw and have well performance they do not have a specific goal of lower requirement either since that be what allow the network to move so fast solana have also be criticize for have some potentially shady business practice and forget to inform read lie to the community tldr in short ethereum s goal be to be like the internet use cardano have a fair distribution of ada coin decentralization at team level vs protocol distribute network and decentralization be concept much old than bitcoin satoshi nakamoto prove that it be possible to create decentralize value that people could own share and transfer without a middleman in do so he lay the foundation for the entire cryptocurrency industry or if you prefer blockchain network every public blockchain network need native coin to enable decentralization itself coin may play a different role in each project but they have one thing in common it be necessary to ensure their fair distribution imagine you want to start a new decentralized project what do you need first of all someone have to define the goal or mission of the project and its basic parameter then some research and analysis will take place this be follow by protocol implementation and launch for many project the launch be just the beginning no protocol in the world can ever be say to be fully complete on the contrary each protocol continue to be work on and develop by a team or community that say the most important thing any protocol have be a team maintenance improvement and new feature be never end job if the protocol work well it will find its user as the number of user grow the amount and scope of work on the protocol naturally increase the team must be pay for their work on the protocol some entity or body manage the work on the project and must secure funding thus if a new decentralized project be create some of the coin usually stay with a foundation or team for protocol development wait a minute how come we re talk about decentralization and some team be work on a protocol be this similar to say microsoft work on the windows operating system there no way it should be every blockchain project should be open source the iog team work on cardano have all the source code public and also all the scientific study nothing be patent everything belong to the community as much as to the team decentralization at the team level be a difficult if not impossible thing it be difficult to decentralize at this level because only a few people often programmer deal with a give protocol on a daily basis programming networking cryptography and other thing be too complex for ordinary people there will always be a team behind the protocol even bitcoin have a team satoshi nakamoto abruptly leave in silence but hand the project over to another programmer the source code be on github people report bug and the team fix they and work on improvement try to create governance where people understand the problem from the user side and express their opinion which be then implement by the team be probably the good that can be achieve what be important to we be not control over the source code of the protocol but control over the network consensus and funding of the development the team deliver new version of the protocol and the people be the one who be motivate to keep the network run this be where we finally get to the debate about project coin decentralization at the network level be do via native coin in the case of the cardano protocol ada coin be use for this this mean that everyone who hold ada coin be a so call stakeholder such a person be actively involve in decentralization and network security the way it work economically be that if there be demand for the coin the coin have a market value if a team or foundation also have coin it have enough resource to develop the protocol how do the team get to the coin either they keep a portion at the very beginning of the project launch or they secure some stable income at the protocol level or some combination of both how to fairly launch a new project how to start a new project to make coin distribution fair clearly at the source code level each team can set up exactly what they need at the beginning of course change can occur in the protocol at any later time but this should only be in accordance with the wish of the majority of the community this allow the team to decide at the beginning how many coin to keep for themselves for their advisor or to sell to seed investor a part of the coin will then be sell publicly of course not all of the coin that will always exist will be sell most protocol release new coin into circulation for a define period of time or forever it depend on the monetary policy of each project what be most important for a fair launch be a ratio between the coin that be sell to the public at launch and the coin that the team keep the team should strive to decentralize the protocol as much as possible thus it can not keep most of the coin for itself or for venture capital vc the team should only keep as much coin as be strictly necessary for the first year of the project s development after that it should secure funding through the collection of transaction fee and some form of decentralize management we deliberately do not want to define some precise boundary as to when a launch be fair and when it be not however we believe that the team should keep less than half of the coin that will be in circulation the rest of the coin should be sell publicly why as we say coin owner have control over the network consensus if the team keep most of the coin it will of course also keep control of the network itself in that case it be not a decentralized network the network must be trustworthy right from the start trust in the network should grow over time the team must not be able to manipulate either the network or the price of coin on the open market if the majority of people trust the community and by extension the network they buy the project s coin the team must not be able to sell coin in bulk and thereby harm the community the team should be transparent and publish the address where they keep the coin this way the community can keep an eye on what be happen with the coin the team can keep the coin not only for development but also for other purpose for example as airdrop to get the coin out to the public also as reward for those who do something useful for the ecosystem the team can fund development from volunteer or third party however everything should always be completely transparent and most importantly it must not come at the expense of decentralization be bitcoin the fair startup project it hard to say satoshi create bitcoin before it launch so he may have fund it himself in the beginning not many people know about the project and satoshi mine a high number of btc coin himself the problem be that today we do not know if anyone have access to the coin the fate of the coin be unclear and shroud in the belief that satoshi will not spend his coin unfortunately neither team probably have access to btc coin the funding of the bitcoin project be not transparent it would be well for bitcoin if satoshi give the coin to the development team if funding be not clear team may struggle to fund research and development an organization may come in and subsidize only the development that be useful to they without any guarantee that it will also be useful to user bitcoin be say to change only slowly this narrative can mask the fact that there be no funding for development development can only be afford by developer who themselves own large amount of btc coin from the beginning of the era avalanche be close to hit 100 here be some dd for you all avax explainedwhat be avalanche avalanche be a new blockchain network with sub second transaction time and low fee create by ava labs a company lead by cornell researcher emin gn sirer the project launch its mainnet in september 2020 after raise 18 million from prominent investment firm such as andreesen horowitz and polychain capital the project raise another 42 million in under 45 hour with the public launch of its avax token in july 2020 with the state goal of outclass eth20 in term of throughput and latency how it work the avalanche network consist of multiple blockchain and use a novel proof of stake consensus mechanism to achieve high throughput estimate to reach over 4500 transaction per second avalanche claim that its consensus protocol combine the benefit of nakamoto consensus robustness scale and decentralization and classical consensus speed quick finality and energy efficiency to form a revolutionary consensus engine under the avalanche model each chain be a separate instance of a virtual machine with support for multiple custom virtual machine such as evm and wasm allow chain to have use case specific functionality each of these virtual machine be deploy on a custom blockchain network call a subnet which be comprise of a dynamic set of validator work together to achieve consensus on the state of a set of blockchain in other word each subnet have its own set of incentive mechanism to ensure validator stay honest avalanche can thus be describe as a platform of platform consist of thousand of subnet to form a single interoperable network the avalanche ethereum bridge through its accelerator avalanche x ava labs be invest heavily in grant to defi project one of these grant go to chainsafe to develop a cross chain ethereum bridge the avalanche ethereum bridge be a two way token bridge that enable seamless erc20 and erc721 transfer between avalanche and ethereum in order to use ethereum base asset with dapp on avalanche user can lock these asset in the chainbridge contract and mint an equivalent token on the avalanche network the benefit as defi become increasingly popular user be be price out of the ecosystem due to ethereum s high network fee with the price of eth on the rise even basic token swap on ethereum be become prohibitively expensive for entry level player while interaction with more complex defi contract can come attach with fee exceed 01 eth far as gas price on ethereum be subject to sudden spike many of these transaction will fail cost the user potentially hundred of dollar worth of eth without even execute the transaction the avalanche ethereum bridge represent a step towards migrate ethereum s slow and costly defi infrastructure to the significantly fast and cheap avalanche network transaction fee on avalanche be rarely more than a few cent while even complicated computation cost in the single digit dollar range to execute and be significantly fast currently so rapid as to be near instantaneous implication the implication of the avalanche network and the advent of the avalanche ethereum bridge be wide and far reach accessibility the low cost of transaction on avalanche mean that small trade be more financially viable open up the defi ecosystem to small player and entry level investor while the user experience be still complex and represent a significant barrier to entry improvement in this area could lead to a wide range of participant in the world of defi low slippage the slow speed of the ethereum blockchain often lead to significant slippage and fail transaction when conduct on chain trade the fast transaction rate and high throughput of the avalanche network open the door to minimal price slippage and instant trade bring the experience of trading on dex close to that of their centralized counterpart eth20 there have be understandable hype around the upcoming launch of eth20 and the great scalability it promise to bring especially as transaction on ethereum grow ever more costly however with network like avalanche grow in popularity in the meantime the launch of eth20 may end up be less impactful than anticipate avalanche and its underlying token avax be currently the 14th cryptocurrency by total market capitalization accord to coinmarketcap with a current market cap of 13 billion avalanche be ahead of algorand or polygon but behind polkadot and solana current avax price 93 ath 95

it happen in an obvious way usually accompany a fast swing by btc call it out and either ask why it occur or attribute it to some organized manipulation even some well intentione commenter explain how there be increase confidence in the market during a bitcoin surge and so investor jump in alt at the same time the same can be say about a sudden fall where bitcoin lose value suddenly and all the alt follow suite when i first start in crypto i ll admit it confuse i too but now it make sense and hopefully it will to you too alt be market inside market bitcoin be nest in the fiat market and alt be nest in the bitcoin market in order to understand why crypto rise and fall with bitcoin you need to stop think of alt directly in fiat value that too many step this be not like stock where everything be trade against the usd this be crypto where everything be trade against other crypto and the reserve currency be bitcoin as the large share number of trading pair btc be the market stabilizer in the same sort of way that the usd be the reserve currency in the global market yes we have stable coin but they do not dominate control the market like the bitcoin pair when we compare the value of two crypto we can forget that we be actually look at their value in yet a third currency you may be only look at two coin but you be include a third trading pair of fiat instead keep it simple and consider only two asset one trading pair at a time during a share price movement look at the value of your coin and it movement in its value in bitcoin and you ll see an accurate market value of your coin within crypto the magic of the price of all coin move in harmony fall away if there be a significant change against btc you at least have a proper baseline for see true movement of your coin divergence from the baseline within crypto now you can introduce the fiat market into consideration if you want it be the tertiary market in this trio let s make a quick oversimplified example to stock i own both increase 3 when i lookup the value in euros of course not apple be still worth the exact same usd as before now since the euro be small you may say the euro fall 3 instead it all so i can just provide the link to people instead of explain it over and over this be long but simple just read it it important to understand crypto short selling have be happen for year short selling be actually a very easy concept to wrap your head around first understand how your buy sell activity affect price when you buy coin or stock you create upward price pressure and if enough people be buy the price go up it simple supply and demand conversely if you sell especially if enough people sell the price of that thing go down i think we all understand how that work when you buy coin or stock you could say that you ve open a position and when you sell you could say that you ve close your position with a short seller their buying and sell behavior affect the price just like ours do except when they open the position they be sell and when they close the position they be buy its backwards this be because when a short seller open their position they be borrow that stock coin from the broker exchange and then immediately sell it on the market and their selling create downward pressure on the price when its time for the short seller to close their position they basically have to buy that stock coin from the market in order to repay the loan to the broker exchange simple example with a stock let say i want to short 1000 share of a 10 stock so i borrow the share from the broker and then those 1000 share immediately get sell on the open market the 10000 be mine to keep but i have a loan of 1000 share that i have to repay the broker require that i repay the loan with share and not money because the broker borrow those share from a shareholder just before they loan they to i the loan that i take out for the short position have to be repay in share not money which be why when a short seller close their position they have to buy so then let say the price move down from 10 to 5 and i decide that it time to take my 50 profit and close the short position with 5000 i ll repurchase those 1000 share from the market and give the share to the broker in order to repay the loan on the other hand if the price move from 10 to 15 while my short position be open i m screw because now i have to spend 15000 to repurchase the 1000 share that be need to repay my loan to the broker make sense with crypto the derivative market be big business and the derivative that short seller use be call perpetual swap contracts unlike a futures contract with a perp contract there no obligation to actually purchase the underlie coin or commodity with a futures contract whoever hold the contract on the expiration date have to buy the underlying thing aside from know that future contracts exist for crypto set they aside this post be about perpetual swap contracts and how they re use to short crypto perpetual swap contracts do not expire and they re perpetually swap trade back and forth perpetual swap contracts be use for trading include shorting and they re pure trading fodder but the buying and selling of they affect the price of the underlie coin just the same as buy and selling of the coin itself do with perpetual swap contracts most exchange offer levers which allow trader to amplify their gain and loss in some case lever over 100x be available with perpetual people can open a long positon or a short position and they can use lever or not if you use a big lever and the price of the coin move in the wrong direction your whole account can get liquidate fast because of that trader get liquidate all of the time every day on every coin whenever they bet wrong coinglasscom show the roll 24hr total liquidations for longs and shorts on each coin from the exchange that supply they with datum in principle the shorting of crypto be the same as the shorting that can be see in a chart which make it easy to see the trend of what short sellers be do bitfinex s short open interest can be see with the ticker dogeusdshorts and long open interest can be see with dogeusdlong for other coin replace doge with btc or whatever example btcusdshorts here the web version of those chart httpswwwtradingviewcomsymbolsdogeusdshorts httpswwwtradingviewcomsymbolsdogeusdlongs when dogeusdshorts be go up that mean more short seller be open position and cause selling pressure on doge again when short open their position they re borrow from the exchange and immediately sell on the market when dogeusdshorts be go down that mean the short seller be close their position and buy from the market which will either catch and stop a dip or it will cause the price to move high so if doge s price be move up at the same time dogeusdshorts be go down that mean they re either get paper hand and closing or it mean they re getting squeeze if doge price be go down while dogeusdshorts be go down that mean short sellers be take profit as they close their position if dogeusdlongs be move up it create upward price pressure on doge because they re buy perpetual contracts for doge if its go down obviously that mean they re sell when a coin i own be run i like to look at the live datum on coinglasscom that show the rolling 24hour
